text: Agent: The Universidad Politécnica de Madrid (UPM) was founded in 1971.
Agent: UPM is the oldest and largest technical university in Spain.
Agent: UPM has four main campuses: Ciudad Universitaria, Montegancedo, South Vallecas, and Downtown Madrid.
Agent: The Montegancedo Campus is designated as an International Campus of Excellence.
Agent: UPM consists of 18 Schools and Faculties.
Agent: The Rectorate is located in the Ramiro de Maeztu building in Ciudad Universitaria.
Agent: UPM offers undergraduate, master, and PhD degrees in engineering and architecture.
Agent: The minimum passing grade is 5. The maximum grade is 10.
Agent: A grade of 10 with distinction is called Matricula de Honor.
Agent: The academic year is divided into two semesters: autumn and spring.
Agent: The autumn semester starts in September and ends in January.
Agent: The spring semester starts in February and ends in June.
Agent: Exams are typically held in January, June, and July.
Agent: A standard bachelor degree requires 240 ECTS credits.
Agent: A standard bachelor degree takes four years to complete.
Agent: A master degree usually requires between 60 and 120 ECTS credits.
Agent: Politécnica Virtual is the main online portal for students.
Agent: Students use Politécnica Virtual to check grades and enroll in courses.
Agent: Moodle is the e-learning platform used for course materials.
Agent: UPM provides an official email address to all students ending in @alumnos.upm.es.
Agent: Eduroam Wi-Fi is available across all UPM campuses.
Agent: VPN access allows students to connect to UPM services from home.
Agent: The ETSII (Industrial Engineering) is located on Paseo de la Castellana.
Agent: The ETSIT (Telecommunications) is located in Ciudad Universitaria.
Agent: The ETSIINF (Computer Engineering) is located at the Montegancedo Campus.
Agent: The ETSIAE (Aeronautical Engineering) is located in Ciudad Universitaria.
Agent: The ETSICCP (Civil Engineering) is located in Ciudad Universitaria.
Agent: The ETSAM (Architecture) is located in Ciudad Universitaria.
Agent: The ETSIST (Telecommunication Systems) is located at the South Campus (Vallecas).
Agent: The ETSIDI (Industrial Design) is located in the Downtown Madrid campus.
Agent: UPM has the highest number of double degree agreements in Spain.
Agent: The Erasmus+ program allows studying in Europe for one or two semesters.
Agent: The Magalhães program connects UPM with Latin American universities.
Agent: The ATHENS program offers intensive one-week courses in Europe.
Agent: UPM is a member of the CESAER network of technical universities.
Agent: UPM has a strategic partnership with Tongji University in China.
Agent: The Language Center offers courses in English, German, French, and Chinese.
Agent: Official language certification exams like TOEIC are held at UPM.
Agent: English is the primary language for many master programs.
Agent: International students can take Spanish courses at the Language Center.
Agent: The UPM Library network has 16 library points across campuses.
Agent: Ingenio is the search engine for the UPM digital library.
Agent: Students can book study rooms through the library website.
Agent: The library offers laptop loans for students.
Agent: During exam periods, some libraries extend their opening hours.
Agent: UPM has sports facilities including gyms and tennis courts.
Agent: The South Campus has a large swimming pool.
Agent: Students can join UPM sports teams for inter-university competitions.
Agent: The Trofeo Rector is the internal sports league of UPM.
Agent: Actúaupm is the entrepreneurship program for startups.
Agent: UPM creates around 20 spin-off companies per year.
Agent: The Innovatech workshop helps researchers market their technologies.
Agent: UPM is a leader in patent applications among Spanish universities.
Agent: The Center for Biomedical Technology (CTB) is a major research hub.
Agent: The Center for Supercomputing (CESVIMA) houses the Magerit supercomputer.
Agent: The Solar Energy Institute (IES) is located at UPM.
Agent: UPM participates in the EELISA European University alliance.
Agent: Tuition fees are set by the Community of Madrid.
Agent: Scholarships are available from the Spanish Ministry of Education.
Agent: UPM offers its own scholarships for international mobility.
Agent: The Mentor Project connects senior students with freshmen.
Agent: Each School has a Student Delegation (Delegación de Alumnos).
Agent: Cultural associations at UPM include theater, music, and cinema clubs.
Agent: The Tuna is a traditional musical group of university students.
Agent: UPM organizes an annual Employment Forum for job seekers.
Agent: The COIE provides career guidance and internship opportunities.
Agent: Internships can be curricular (for credit) or extracurricular.
Agent: Companies can post job offers on the UPM Job Bank.
Agent: The Final Degree Project (TFG) is mandatory for graduation.
Agent: The Master Thesis (TFM) must be defended publicly.
Agent: PhD programs usually take three to five years.
Agent: UPM has a Code of Ethics for the university community.
Agent: The Equality Unit promotes gender equality at UPM.
Agent: UPM is committed to the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).
Agent: The Carbon Footprint project aims to reduce campus emissions.
Agent: UPM has a Psychological Attention Service for students.
Agent: The Disability Care Unit supports students with special needs.
Agent: The University Ombudsman defends the rights of students.
Agent: Public transport cards are discounted for students under 26.
Agent: The Metro station for Ciudad Universitaria is Line 6.
Agent: The Metro station for South Campus is Sierra de Guadalupe.
Agent: A shuttle bus connects Montegancedo with the city.
Agent: UPM alumni include several Nobel Prize laureates.
Agent: The School of Mines is located in a historic building in Rios Rosas.
Agent: The School of Forestry is located in Ciudad Universitaria.
Agent: UPM collaborates with Airbus and other aerospace companies.
Agent: The I&E (Innovation and Entrepreneurship) minor is popular.
Agent: Students can print documents at the reprography centers.
Agent: The UPM card is used for library loans and access control.
Agent: Enrollment changes can be requested during the modification period.
Agent: Part-time enrollment is allowed for working students.
Agent: Visiting professors from top universities teach at UPM.
Agent: UPM hosts the Summer School every July.
Agent: The FabLab is a digital fabrication laboratory for students.
Agent: Hackathons are frequently organized by student associations.
Agent: The BEST (Board of European Students of Technology) has a UPM branch.
Agent: UPM supports open access publishing for research.
Agent: The Gateway to Engineering program helps high school students.
Agent: UPM is consistently ranked as the top technical university in Spain.
Agent: The motto of UPM is Technica Impendi Nationi.
